wiki.text:
'Notations' is a book that was edited and compiled by American avant-garde
composer John Cage (1912–1992) with Alison Knowles, first published in 1969. The
book is made up of a large collection of graphical scores, facsimiles of
holographs, from the Foundation for Contemporary Performance Arts, with text by
269 composers, which are presented in alphabetical order, with each score
getting equal space, and in which the editor has no more authority than the
reader in assigning value to the work.
wiki.title: notations
